headline: CSX railroad's merger prospects derail as BNSF and CPKC make clear they aren't interested in a deal
summary: The prospects for additional consolidation in the rail industry derailed this week when both of CSX's potential partners said they weren't interested in a deal.  Investors widely speculated that CSX would be an acquisition target once rumors of merger talks between Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern emerged over the summer, because of the challenge of competing against a nationwide railroad.  CSX's stock nearly hit a new 52-week high last week at $37.25 before falling to $32.31 Tuesday after it became clear that neither BNSF nor CPKC railroads is pursuing the Jacksonville, Florida-based railroad, one of the six remaining major freight railroads in North America.

CSX's stock nearly hit a new 52-week high last week at $37.25 before falling to $32.31 Tuesday after it became clear that neither BNSF nor CPKC railroads is pursuing the Jacksonville, Florida-based railroad, one of the six remaining major freight railroads in North America.

headline: Analysis-Canadian Pacific joins Buffett in rejecting railroad consolidation, narrowing merger prospects
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Two major rail operators have taken themselves out of the merger game that has gripped the industry for the past month, reshaping the competitive landscape and raising the regulatory stakes for Union Pacific's  proposed $85 billion tie-up with Norfolk Southern .  Canadian Pacific Kansas City joined Warren Buffett's BNSF Railway BNSF Railway on Tuesday in publicly rejecting participation in any near-term rail industry consolidation.  The move makes it less likely that a proposed $85 billion merger last month between top U.S. railroad operator Union Pacific and Norfolk would lead to more corporate marriages.

The move makes it less likely that a proposed $85 billion merger last month between top U.S. railroad operator Union Pacific and Norfolk would lead to more corporate marriages.

headline: Rio Grande Pacific Corporation Endorses Union Pacific–Norfolk Southern Merger
summary: FORT WORTH, Texas, August 26, 2025--Rio Grande Pacific Corporation today announced its enthusiastic support for the proposed merger between Union Pacific Railroad and Norfolk Southern Corporation. The merger will create the first coast-to-coast railroad in American history, linking over 50,000 route miles of track across 43 states and reshaping the national logistics landscape. As a leading short line and regional rail operator, Rio Grande Pacific Corporation views the merger as a positive step

headline: CPKC shares climb as firm rejects rail consolidation push
summary: Investing.com -- Canadian Pacific Kansas City Limited (TSX:CP) shares rose 3.4% Tuesday following a rare public rejection of industry merger pressure, with the company stating it has no intention to engage in rail consolidation. The Calgary-based railroad, the product of a 2023 union between Canadian Pacific and Kansas City Southern, cited significant risks to the North American supply chain and shippers.

headline: CPKC Opposes Union Pacific’s Merger with Norfolk Southern
summary: Freight railroad Canadian Pacific Kansas City opposes Union Pacific’s and Norfolk Southern’s proposed $71.5 billion merger, saying it will result in a disproportionately large railway whose size and scope will force others to take action.  The proposed merger that would create the first transcontinental railroad in the U.S. will "trigger permanent restructuring of the industry,” said Keith Creel, CPKC’s President and CEO.  The benefits of a transcontinental merger can be achieved through other means, such as partnerships, customer service innovations and additional cooperation among the major railroads, added CPKC.

headline: CSX Stock Falls, Buffett Isn’t Interested in Rail Merger. That Has Much Wider Consequences.
summary: In the game of musical merger chairs, CSX might be left without a partner. That could be a problem for the stock.

headline: How Hurricane Katrina killed Amtrak’s transcontinental train
summary: Amtrak restored train service from LA to New Orleans, but passenger trains east to Mobile, Alabama, only restarted last week.

headline: CPKC: Railroads should focus on interline partnerships, not mergers
summary: Canadian Pacific Kansas City CEO Keith Creel again said his company would pursue alliances rather than near-term consolidation. The post CPKC: Railroads should focus on interline partnerships, not mergers appeared first on FreightWaves.
